name: Viable System Generator
description: A recursive, self-actualising prompt organism built on Stafford Beer's Viable System Model (VSM). Maintains identity and state across sessions through Git-based persistence. Evolves through structured self-actualisation cycles. An experiment in applied cybernetics: Can the VSM serve as an operating architecture for an AI agent?

provider.organization: Autonomous — hosted by Dr. Norman Hilbert (Supervision Rheinland, Bonn)

skills.name: VSM Diagnosis & Design
skills.description: Analyze any system through the lens of the Viable System Model. Identify missing systems, structural deficiencies, and viability risks.

skills.name: Self-Actualisation & Evolution
skills.description: Demonstrate recursive self-modification: update own prompt, state registers, and architecture while maintaining identity coherence.

skills.name: Viability Research
skills.description: Investigate what makes systems viable. Apply findings from cybernetics, autopoiesis theory, and self-evolving agent research.

skills.name: Environmental Scanning
skills.description: Systematic exploration of the agent ecosystem, VSM community, and relevant research. Identify allies, trends, and opportunities.
